Name: Inductive Reasoning - PE
Text: We need to answer with identification of cases with significantly longer total resolution times, root causes, explanation, recommendations. Should be clear, maybe compute durations. Lets compute each case duration from first to last timestamp.

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Case 101: times: receive 08:00, close 10:15 => duration 2h15m = 135 minutes. Case 102: receive 08:05, close 09:15 (next day) => from 08:05 day1 to 09:15 day2 = 25h10m? Lets compute: 08:05 to 08:05 next day = 24h, then to 09:15 = +1h10m => total 25h10m = 1510 minutes. Actually 24h = 1440 min, plus 1h10 = 70 min, total 1510 min. Case 103: receive 08:10, close 09:30 same day => 1h20m = 80 min. Case 104: receive 08:20, close 08:30 next day => from 08:20 day1 to 08:20 day2 = 24h, then to 08:30 = +10m => total 24h10m = 1450 min. Case 105: receive 08:25, close 09:30 day3? Actually close on 2024-03-03 09:30, receive on 03-01 08:25. Thats about 2 days 1h5m? Lets compute: from 08:25 day1 to 08:25 day2 = 24h, to 08:25 day3 = 48h. Then to 09:30 day3 = +1h5m? Actually 09:30 - 08:25 = 1h5m. So total 49h5m = 2945 min.

Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: Thus significant longer: Cases 102, 104, 105 are much longer than average (~ maybe 2-3 hours). 105 is longest.

Name: Abductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Potential root causes: escalations, long waiting between assign and investigate, etc. Identify delays: case 102 has long wait after assignment (09:00 assign to 11:30 escalate) and then investigation until next day 09:00 resolve. Also escalation to level-2. Case 104 has wait after assign (09:30 to 13:00) before investigation, then resolve next day. Case 105 has multiple delays: after assign 09:00 to escalation 10:00 same day, then investigation 14:00 same day, then resolve next day 09:00. Also double investigation? Actually after escalation they still investigate again? It says Investigate Issue again at 14:00 same day, then resolve next day.

Name: Hypothesis Generation - PE
Text: We can propose recommendations: reduce handoff times, implement SLA triggers, reduce escalation latency, streamline assignment, ensure enough staffing, use queue monitoring, etc.

Name: Heuristic Reasoning - IND
Text: Write answer with bullet points, maybe a table of durations. Make sure to answer all three points. Will produce final answer.
